texts.text: "Minecraft Live!" redirects here. For the 2 predecesors, see Minecraft annual events § Minecraft Live.

Minecraft Festival is an in-person Minecraft convention similar to MINECON that is planned to be held in Orlando, Florida, in late 2022 on a yet to be announced date. It was originally set to be held in 25-27 September 2020, but was postponed twice due to the COVID-19 pandemic.[1][2] The online portion of the event is called Minecraft Live! [sic][3]

1 Announcement
2 Location
3 Tickets
4 Cape
5 Gallery
6 See also
7 References
At MINECON Live 2019 on 28 September 2019, it was announced that Minecraft Festival would be held in Orlando, Florida, through 25-27 September 2020.[4]
On 5 March 2020, it was announced that the festival has been postponed until late 2021, due to safety concerns about the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.[1]
On 3 September 2020, during the announcement of Minecraft Live 2020, it was announced that the festival has been postponed to a yet to be announced date in 2022.[2]
Minecraft Festival will be held in the South Hall at the Orange County Convention Center, located at 9899 International Drive, Orlando, Florida 32819.[5]
Tickets will be available for purchase online beginning on an undetermined date in 2022.
There is a limit of 12 tickets per transaction. Attendees are able to purchase up to four Upgrade Package Tickets (Diamond and Gold) and eight tickets of any other type.[5]
Minecraft Festival tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable.[5]
It was announced that those attending Minecraft Festival would receive an exclusive Minecraft Festival cape, compatible with both Java and Bedrock editions.[6] The cape design is unknown.
"Everything We Announced at MINECON Live 2019" – Minecraft.net
